text: Hi Zack :slightly_smiling_face: Thank you! That was exactly what I needed to do! Perfect! Thank you again!

Good morning everyone, anyone got experience with the assosiation endpoint? I have a deal I want to get the products assosiated with. I use the definition 19 to get the lines. Once I have the lines, I use the line endpoint to get each line. But some of the results have the "properties" field empty (found out that was the products not in library) and some only have the "product id" and not the quantity. Am I doing something wrong? *EDIT: Found out! My bad! Needed to add the properties to the url as get params (as it says in the docs)*

I am trying to get a line item by ID, but I am getting this error message: *"Must have scope deal-line-item-read".* Tried to find a scope in my app about deals or lines, but there are none? I have the scope: *contacts, content.* Anyone know what scope I need?

Hello everyone
So I have some emails included on my plan
However, I cannot generate an SMTP API because I don't really have the Transactional Email service (because of the additional cost)
So how can I send my emails programatically without having the TE service?
Hi there! Does anyone have any tips for using Python with the new API features? I'd like to search for contacts via the email address. Documentation is not the most helpful :disappointed:

Hey <@UU9NZ1U2K> I’m one of the people working on the documentation.  I want to understand what could be more helpful about it if you wouldn’t mind.  I also may be able to help with your specific request but no promises since I’m not a python expert

I am new to HubSpot and have inherited a code base that relies on pulling data from HubSpot.  The HubSpot CRMs that we are pulling data from have hundred's of thousands of contacts and as I attempt to match contact and owner, I am encountering multiple rate limit (429) HTTP errors.  How do applications typically recover from them, and what can be done to prevent/minimize them.
